page.title: 20View from above
page.content: On a hot Sunday afternoon in July,Mr Morgan and I took a flight over block 0480 0414.We were both slightly nervous but our fears quickly disappeared as we were greeted by the whole of the Isle of Axholme stretching before us. The fields below were like a gigantic patchwork and the patterns made by the agricultural machinery could clearly be seen.As we flew over Eastoft for the first time I could see many of my friends playing on the green and looking up and waving.As we flew onto Luddington the local cricket team were practising. I was surprised at the number of drains,dykes and fields that make up our area,and how few houses there were in the landscape.
